com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.core

Class Switch<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sri.ai.grinder.rewriter.core.Switch<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Rewriter, TopRewriter, com.sri.ai.util.base.BinaryFunction<Expression,Context,Expression>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BindingTopSimplifier, BooleanSimplifier, CardinalityOfSetConstantSimplifier, DistributeIntersectionOverUnionTopRewriter, ElementOfExtensionalSetTopRewriter, ElementOfIntensionalUnionTopRewriter, EqualitySimplifier, ExtensionalSetEqualEmptySetTopRewriter, IfEquals, IfRewriter, InequalitySimplifier, IntensionalSetConditionTopRewriter, IntensionalSetFalseConditionToEmptySetTopRewriter, IntensionalSetToConditionalTopRewriter, IntensionalUnionEqualToEmptySetTopRewriter, IntensionalUnionIntersectionEqualToEmptySetTopRewriter, IntensionalUnionToUnionsOfIntensionalSetsOfBaseTypeTopRewriter, IntersectionEmptySetTopRewriter, IntersectionExtensionalSetTopRewriter, IntersectionIntensionalSetsTopRewriter, LambdaBetaReductionSimplifier, NumericSimplifier, QuantifierEliminatorOfFunctionOnIntensionalSetTopRewriter, QuantifierTopRewriter, SetExpressionIsEqualToEmptySetTopRewriter, SetIntersectExtensionalSetEqualToEmptySetTopRewriter, TupleEqualityTopRewriter, TupleGetSetTopRewriter, TupleValuedFreeVariablesTopRewriter, UnionEmptySetTopRewriter, UnionOfSetsEqualEmptySetTopRewriter

    public class Switch<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements TopRewriter
    A rewriter that stores a map from keys in some type to base Rewriters and a key maker function to Expressions to the key type. When rewriting an expression, it computes a key for it and acts as the key's corresponding base rewriter. If the computed key has no corresponding base rewriter, the same expression instance is returned. Switch rewriters can be merged. If there are two Switch rewriters S1 and S2 using the same key maker function (instance-wise, naturally, since it would be too hard to decide that two distinct instance of function objects represent the same key maker), they can be merged into a new Switch rewriter S. This merged rewriter S maps each key value K into a FirstOf rewriter composed of the rewriters under the same key value K in S1 and S2, in this order (or just the original base rewriter if K is used in only one of S1 and S2.
    Author:
    braz

    • Field Detail

      • FUNCTOR

        public static final com.google.common.base.Function<Expression,java.lang.String> FUNCTOR
        A standard key maker mapping expressions to their functors's string value (unfortunately, this is different from their toString() output -- for example, the functor of 'if p then 1 else 0' has string value "if . then . else ." but toString returns "'if . then . else .'"). Using standard key makers minimizes search cost in merged Switch rewriters because merging uses instance identity of key makers (see mergeSwitchesWithTheSameKeyMakerIntoASingleOne(List).

      • SYNTACTIC_FORM_TYPE

        public static final com.google.common.base.Function<Expression,java.lang.Object> SYNTACTIC_FORM_TYPE
        A standard key maker mapping expressions to the syntactic form types. Using standard key makers minimizes search cost in merged Switch rewriters because merging uses instance identity of key makers (see mergeSwitchesWithTheSameKeyMakerIntoASingleOne(List).
